November 10, 1950
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
Radio Station WUOA
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
Our meeting at Lexington must have taken place
a long, long time ago1 At least I have been so busy
since getting home from the convention, and so many
things have happened, that it seems as though the
NAEB convention must have taken place at least in
August! Only today have I had a chance to sit down
to review NAEB matters and try to put affairs in
order*
The first affair, so far as I am concerned, is
the News-Letter* You will recall that we requested
the chairmen of all sessions to supply me with a
one-page summary of what transpired at their meet¬
ings. I wonder if you could send me by return mail
a summary of your Sunday meeting You wonft have
to include anything about the report I gave--unless
you want to!--put I would like to get a summary
from you for all the rest. This will serve as the
basis for a portion of the review of the convention
which I will try to make a feature of the November
News-Letter*
Let me congratulate you again (in writing this
time) on your election as vice president. I am sure
you will serve us well.
